event.name: LOSTSUN_MISSILES_DRIFT
event.text: A destroyed Rock ship drifts, its hull picked clean recently. However, you are lucky and find one surviving crate of ammunition.

event.name: LOSTSUN_SHRINE
event.text: A team of Lost Sun ships appear to be demolishing a nearby Crystalline shrine. They hail you, asking if you can spare any explosives.

"We were not expecting a supply ship any time soon, and this may help." They fire a rocket directly into the foundation of the structure, sending the entire thing crumbling. "Surprising. We have not had access to quality ammunitions such as these in a long time. May we keep the spares?"
"Your good will has been noted. Let us repay you, captain."

choice.text: Request that they give the spares back.

event.text: "Fine, but do not think that we will forget this. You may think these come in easy supply, but they do not."

choice.text: Apologize and turn down their offer.

event.text: The Lost Suns do not try to hail you again. You put some distance between yourself and them just in case.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CACHE
event.text: An incessant beeping on your radar shows a strange object floating in empty space. It appears to be... a Lost Sun weapon cache?
Stealing military supplies in Lost Sun territory doesn't sound like a good idea. You leave it be.
You pry open the cache to find racks and racks of ammunition.
The cache is filled mostly with first aid supplies and rations. You do however find a fire weapon, the black sheep of the supplies.
The cache is harder to open than you expected. You spend some time trying to open it when a Lost Sun ship spots you, and attacks! You abandon the cache and prepare to fight.

event.name: LOSTSUN_DONATION
event.text: A Lost Sun fleet appears to be protecting the nearby moon, which houses a relatively large mining operation. On closer inspection, it seems the fleet is poorly armed.

"A Federation ship, in our sector? Are you another supply runner?" You shake your head. "Hmph. I do not normally request help from strangers who may or may not be welcome, but we are in need of ammunition. Do you have any warheads that you can spare?"
"I see you are not sparing with your supplies. All the same, it was not my place to ask. Something is better than nothing..."
Reluctantly, the Lost Sun captain gives you some scrap as payment.
"This is quite the supply. You surprise me, Federation captain. I suppose I am now in your debt."
Thankful for your large donation, the Lost Suns pay you back with ample scrap.
"Interesting technology. I have heard of it, yes, but our budget is low. This will help us considerably. Thank you, captain."
The Lost Suns repay your tech with some of their own, as well as some scrap.
"As expected. Hurry along then, and hope misfortune does not follow you."
There isn't anything that concerns you here. You fly away.

event.name: ASTEROID_EXPLORE_LOSTSUN
event.text: Scans reveal a large asteroid field nearby. Short-range scanners may discover useful materials while we wait for the FTL to recharge.

choice.text: Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge.

event.text: You decide to ignore the asteroids.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Mining Equipment) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Attempt to mine the asteroids. [-1|]

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CIVILIAN_RESCUE
event.text: You see a Lost Sun ship attacking an unarmed civilian ship trying to pass through the sector. You doubt the Lost Sun notices you, due to its complete focus on mauling civilians.
You kick your engines into high gear and chase away the Lost Sun from the civilian. Time for a fight.
The civilians continue trying to hail you. You tune them out and fly away until you're completely alone.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CHALLENGERS
event.text: A Lost Sun ship protecting this beacon promptly hails you a little while after jumping in nearby. "A passing ship! We have a challenge for you. Best us in combat, and we shall give you a reward. Accept a greater challenge, and we shall give an even greater reward!"

choice.text: Fight them for a normal reward.

event.text: "Let the battle commence!"

choice.text: Fight them without life support or medical systems.

event.text: "Let the battle commence!"

choice.text: Fight them with a weakened reactor.

event.text: "Let the battle commence!"
"Let the battle commence!"

choice.text: Fight them with severely weakened systems.

event.text: "Let the battle commence!"

choice.text: We aren't looking for a fight.

event.text: "I did not take you for cowards. Oh well, perhaps it is for the best."

event.name: LOSTSUN_PRISONERS
event.text: A Lost Sun confinement appears to be keeping several ships from various origins captive. A patrol ship is searching the area, and you won't have long until it sees you.

choice.text: Attack the barricade and free the civilians.

event.text: Your attacks are inefficient, and several countershots get through your defenses. You get out of their range in time but the patrol ship moves in to attack!
You know you're taking a risk, but you could use the extra scrap. You power up your weapons and engage the patrol ship.
You manage to escape the patrol ship. You should still leave the beacon as soon as possible.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Wait for the patrol ship to pass by, then sabotage their defenses.

event.text: Your waiting pays off when the patrol ship passes right by, and eventually passes out of your view. You sneak up to the confinement and lay down the explosives, then fly to a safe distance to watch the fireworks.

Chaos erupts in the Lost Sun structure as explosions ripple across the surface. One appears to have disabled the main power to the shield keeping the civilians at bay, and they escape. The civilians spot you and, putting two and two together, decide to pay you for freeing them.

event.name: LOSTSUN_ROCK_SPY
event.text: A Rock spy appears to be hiding in this asteroid field. You don't see them for very long until they've already slipped out of sight.
There's no reason to be chasing down random Rock ships in asteroid fields. You prepare to leave as quickly as possible.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Use your improved engines to track them down.

event.text: You manage to catch up to the Rock spy. They don't take kindly to you following them, and attack.
You manage to catch up to the Rock spy. They don't take kindly to you following them, and attack.
You are unable to track down the Rock ship, leaving you lost in the asteroids.

You successfully manage to track down the Rock ship, but not fast enough. A large asteroid crashes into their hull, tearing the ship apart. You try to scrap what you can without suffering the same fate.

event.name: LOSTSUN_MANTIS_LOST
event.text: The red ship at this beacon belongs to the Mantis. With no obvious motives, you aren't sure why they came here.
Theres no words that need be exchanged. As soon as you begin to approach it is clear that your intentions are hostile, and the Mantis prepare to defend themselves.

The Mantis appear mildly shocked that you reached out to them. Before they can speak however, a Lost Sun ship comes flying out of nowhere and blasts the Mantis ship into oblivion. They seem to identify you as a threat as well.
Contrary to expectations, the Mantis make no attempt to follow. You distance yourself from their ship.
Most of the wreckage is too charred to be salvaged, but you still scrap what you can.

Upon investigation, the bridge of the ship fared slightly better than the rest of the ship. A lone Mantis survivor lays trembling in the corner, and almost kills one of your crew as you approach. However after some coaxing you convince him to join your crew.

The weaponry that destroyed this ship has left only worthless junk. As you are about to give up, your eye catches a small crate drifting near what was once the cargo-bay. It contains a few fuel cells that managed to survive the explosion.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CHALLENGE
event.text: A Lost Sun ship at this beacon has already spotted you before it's too late to slip away unnoticed. They hail you.

"So, you are the Federation Renegade that we have heard so much about, intruding on our sector in some dangerous quest to destroy the Flagship? Brave, and stupid. Stupid that you think you have the right to endanger our sector by drawing the fleet here. If you wish to pass unharmed, you must answer some questions and prove you are worthy."
"We Lost Suns have been fighting a war against the brutal Rock dictatorship for years. For which crime do we hold them responsible and sparked the start of this bloody war?"

choice.text: The use of propaganda to lie to their citizens.

event.text: "The Coalition might be a divisive and problematic side effect, but the true problem originates from the Rock Elders and their lies! Of course, the Federation would certainly love for us to exhaust our resources against the Coalition. Let us teach you a well-deserved lesson."
"That is not even a crime! If you cannot even be mature, then it is clear you do not belong here. Prepare to have your life extinguished."

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) The use of propaganda to lie to their citizens.

event.text: "Expected. Then your untimely death is your fault, and your fault alone."

event.name: LOSTSUN_CHALLENGE_CORRECT_1
event.text: "Very good, though that was a question anyone but the Rock people themselves could answer."
"Which race is the strongest and most pure of any other?"
"You are incorrect. You think pandering to us will get you anywhere? No race is pure! You are not worthy of such treatment. Prepare to be destroyed by filthy mortal flames."

"Bah haha! That is the lie told to us from birth! The Crystals are no gods, they are used as false idols! Clearly, you too believe the lies of the Elders. We will remove you from this world in which you do not belong."
The Lost Sun captain descends into clear rage. "You think this is funny? The Federation is not even a race! I have no time for this idiocy. I will erase your ignorance with fire!"

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) None. There is no such thing as a holy race.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CHALLENGE_CORRECT_2
event.text: "Indeed. The very idea that a race was chosen by gods to be superior is flawed, and unproven; any government claiming otherwise is only exploiting these beliefs to control the masses as they wish to secure their own authority."
"No government is free of lies or scandals. Prove to us that you see through the lies that your precious Federation has been spreading for years."

choice.text: The Federation has been supporting the Lost Suns only to cripple the Coalition.
The Federation is as responsible for the Rebellion as the Rebels themselves.
The Federation has committed as many warcrimes as any of their enemies.
The Federation has never told a lie.

event.text: "Hah! So you are truly a simple minded fool, following what you are told blindly. There is no room for people like you in this galaxy."

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) Your crew does not know the answer.

event.name: LOSTSUN_CHALLENGE_CORRECT_3
event.text: "You impress me, captain. I have challenged many, many ships who have passed through here before, and not one has been able to prove themselves. You have my respect. Let me come with you on your journey, so that I may see how a surveyor of truth such as yourself handles such a daunting mission that awaits you."

event.name: LOSTSUN_ROCK_SETTLEMENT
event.text: An entire Rock settlement, a remnant from before the Lost Sun's takeover of this sector, is rooted on the nearby planetoid. However that record doesn't seem like it will last long, as a Lost Sun ship is assaulting the settlement's poorly maintained defenses.

choice.text: Help the Rockmen and destroy the Lost Suns.

event.text: Not all Rockmen should be blamed for the antagony of their government. You block the Lost Suns and prepare to fight.

choice.text: Aid in the destruction of the settlement.

event.text: You approach to attack the settlement but the Lost Sun ship stops you. "Renegade, this is not a job for you. Leave this beacon so that we may carry out our duty." You fly a safe distance away before they can reinforce their words with weapons.
You try not to think of all the innocent lives that will be lost because of this attack, and try to focus on doing something aboard the ship instead.

The Rockmen are grateful for your help. They were a small farming colony that was cut off from the main trade routes after the Lost Suns captured the sector and were stuck in poverty. A few good-natured Federation ships in the past had given them some supplies, but this inevitably led to their discovery. They have nothing to pay you, so instead they fix up your hull.

The colony did not fare as well as you had expected. Most of the Lost Sun's attacks had made their way past the weak shield protecting the structures on the surface, killing a good portion of their population. They have nothing that they can spare you other than a feeble thank you, but one of the survivors offers to join your crew, as his life in the settlement no longer holds any promise.

event.name: DISTRESS_LOSTSUN_CIVILIAN
event.text: A poorly armed Union ship is stuck at this beacon, evidently out of fuel. They beg you to spare them some capsules so that they can escape the sector before a Lost Sun patrol finds them.
The Union citizens are grateful for your help.
They don't have much scrap to spare, but decide to lend some extra missiles and perform repairs to your hull.

choice.text: Tell them that you cannot help.

event.text: In a fit of pure desperation and as a last ditch attempt to save their lives, the Unionists power on their weapons and attack you.

event.name: DISTRESS_LOSTSUN_WRECK
event.text: You arrive to the location of the distress beacon, but the ship that was once here has been reduced to a singed wreck. It is impossible to discern what faction is used to belong to. You don't know what happened to their attacker, but you figure it's safe to salvage.

event.name: DISTRESS_LOSTSUN_COALITION
event.text: A Coalition ship, sent to sabotage the Lost Suns, appears to have already arrived at the location of the distress beacon. Whoever was the original source of the distress is long gone, but the Coalition doesn't intend on letting you go easily.

event.name: QUEST_LOSTSUN_DISRUPTION
event.text: A gathering of Lost Sun ships is nearby. They're suspicious of your presence and begin to distance themselves from your ship.

The Lost Suns are reluctant to respond until you show your Federation badge, which luckily seems to resonate with them. "So, eager to prove your alliance? We have a task for you, but it is of utmost importance. Are you up for a challenge?"

"At the following co-ordinates you will find a Rock comms station set up here to relay information on our revolution to the Rock Elders. We're planning an invasion on the nearby planet which also hosts a Rock settlement, but we cannot do so until the comms station is destroyed. We request that you disable it in any way you can so we can go forward with our attack."

choice.text: We cannot risk our primary mission.

event.text: "Then you already know too much." The other ships disperse while the largest of the group moves in to attack.
Once they see you too avoiding their group, the Lost Suns relax and continue their secretive discussion.

event.name: QUEST_LOSTSUN_DISRUPTION_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Rock comms station targeted by Lost Suns.

event.text: You've found the Rock comms station the Lost Suns told you about. It's very poorly armed, though you can't stage a full scale attack without the settlement dispatching reinforcements.

choice.text: Attempt to fire on the station from a distance.

event.text: Your feeble attacks are ineffective on the station, and a settlement ship is sent to chase you off. Your hull takes some damage but after you've put a good distance between yourself and the settlement the ship stops chasing you.
Your hacking is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Prevent the station from calling for help.

event.text: You attack the station, and engage the Signal Diluter while doing so. Despite your attack being clearly noticed by the station, they appear unable to call for help before their relay systems are damaged. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.

choice.text: (Slug Saboteur) Have your Slug hack into their relay systems.

event.text: Your Slug is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Have your Engi hack into their relay systems.

event.text: Your Engi is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your Engineer hack into their relay systems.

event.text: Your Engineer is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.
It's too risky to attack the station. You hope the Lost Suns find a different way to complete their mission.

event.name: QUEST_LOSTSUN_ESCORT
event.text: Arriving at the beacon, you find there is already a ship here, a very poorly armed Lost Sun. They hail you. "Good, at last someone came. Our distress beacon malfunctioned and we were not sure someone "friendly" would arrive in time. Our ship ran out of ammunitions, and we had to switch to some weaker weapons. Unfortunately, this also means we cannot protect ourselves from the Theocracy and Coalition hunters. We request that you escort us to the nearest outpost."
"Your eagerness to assist us has been noted. We will follow you to these co-ordinates."
"So, the things I have heard about the Federation are true? I should've expected this. Go, leave this place and hope you do not fall victim to the same enemies that we are defenseless against."
"No, we do not need your donations or gifts. We only request an escort."
"Your eagerness to assist us has been noted. We will follow you to these co-ordinates."
"So, the things I have heard about the Federation are true? I should've expected this. Go, leave this place and hope you do not fall victim to the same enemies that we are defenseless against."

event.name: LOSTSUN_ESCORT_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Requested escort location of a Lost Sun vessel.

event.text: You arrive at the outpost, but it is too late. A large elite Rock ship has already demolished the structure. They spot you and hardly give you a chance to assess the situation before attacking.

event.name: LOSTSUN_ESCORT_QUEST_RAID_WIN
event.text: You salvage the ship. Much of the wreckage can be recovered as scrap. You offer to share the spoils with the Lost Suns, but they refuse. You salvage what you can carry before contacting them further.

"So, our outpost has been... destroyed. This was unexpected. Your aid is much appreciated Renegade, but I must ask one more favor of you. I have tried to be devoted to the Lost Sun cause, but after this tragedy... the loss of many of my friends... I see now this war of ours will lead to nothing but bloodshed. I have nothing left. May I come with you, to experience all that I would never see if I stayed here, fighting a pointless war?"
The Rockman eagerly hurries to gather his things and come aboard. He says a brief, formal farewell to his crew, wishing them luck in their future struggles.

choice.text: Sorry, but we don't need more crew.

event.text: The Rockman looks upset, but he quickly goes back to his usual formal manner. "I suppose this makes sense. You too are fighting a war as well. As promised, payment is due, even if the outcome of this mission has been a failure."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_LOSTSUN
textList.text: "This is our territory, Renegade. Not all of us welcome your pity. Get out of our sector, or we will send you to the fiery pits of the underworld."
You find yourself in an argument with another Lost Sun ship over restricted beacons and such, and soon their weapons are drawn!
Not all Lost Suns are appreciative of the Federation's help, and some are even angered by it. The one at this beacon most certainly does not appreciate your presence.
Your presence appears to have offended the Lost Sun ship at this beacon in some way, because their weapons are ready and aimed straight at you!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LOSTSUN_SUN
event.text: The Lost Suns have little fear of solar flares. The captain of the ship at this beacon chuckles. "Afraid of a little fire, captain? Let us duel, TO THE DEATH!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK_LOSTSUN
textList.text: "Your alliance with the radical terrorist group that is the Lost Suns will not be tolerated anymore, Federation Renegade."
The Rock government frequently sends ships to attack this sector. One such ship has noticed you, and doesn't risk you revealing their position.
Shots scatter across your defenses, but none do any severe damage. An unseen Rock ship scouting out the sector is attacking!
"Brave, coming here. The Rockmen do not appreciate your support of these arsonists, and we intend to do right by our true leaders!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LOSTSUN_ROCK_ASTEROID
event.text: This asteroid field appears to be housing a Rock spy trying to hide from the Lost Sun patrols as it collects information. They obviously aren't interested in letting you escape with their information, and attack!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_COALITION_LOSTSUN
textList.text: As the Rockmen are a powerful ally of the Coalition, they have requested that some force be dispatched to take care of the Lost Sun threat. The ship here appears to group you in with that threat and attacks!
A Coalition ship hunting down Lost Sun ships spots you. They waste no time to power up their weapons and attack.
An angered Slug captain aboard the Coalition ship at this beacon hails you. "I came here to hunt ssome fire-obsssesssed freaksss, not more Federation asssssholesss! Prepare to be erasssed."

event.text: You lock weapons with the Rock ship, eager to prove your loyalty to the Lost Suns. The Lost Sun ship shows no cowardice, providing support from the background.

You suppose it doesn't hurt to win the Rock's favor. Assuming you destroy the Lost Sun ship, no one will hear about your betrayal. Suprisingly, the Rock continues to provide fire support against the Lost Sun ship.

textList.name: TEXT_LOSTSUN_ROCK_CHOICE
textList.text: A Rock and Lost Sun ship are dueling at this beacon. Both notice you, and surprisingly both also call for your aid.
Taking sides in a duel can be a dangerous way to prove loyalty. At this beacon, a Rock and Lost Sun ship are fighting. Both have clearly noticed you, so you're going to have to save one of them.
Both the Rock and Lost Sun ship at this beacon are aware of your presence, but are too busy fighting to deal with you. Whose side will you take?

You find yourself faced with a dilemma as a Rock and Lost Sun ship are locked in a dogfight at this beacon. Either way, you can't leave without angering both, so you're going to have to make a choice.

event.name: LOSTSUN_ROCK_CHOICE_ROCK_WIN
event.text: "You surprise me, Renegade. Perhaps you really do have our best interest in mind." They pay you in thanks.

event.name: LOSTSUN_ROCK_CHOICE_LOSTSUN_WIN
event.text: "Interesting. This was not the expected result. You Renegades really are the treacherous scum we have been told. Still, we are in your debt, and we intend to pay it off."

event.name: BOARDERS_LOSTSUN_FIRE
event.text: You hear the unmistakable sound of the explosion of a fire bomb and a teleporter's whirl. You aren't sure where they came from, but you have some unwelcome visitors for sure!

event.name: LOSTSUN_FLEET_UNLOCK1
event.text: A Lost Sun vessel is nearby, their captain frantically pacing back and forth. "You there- you side with the Federation? You must assist us. It is of the highest importance."

"Our leader, Admiral Ariadne's personal cruiser has been taken by Inquisition forces at these co-ordinates. You must rescue her under any conditions, or else we are doomed. The Federation is the Lost Suns' only ally, we must rely solely on your efforts for our continued survival."
The Rockman merely grunts and flies away.

event.name: LOSTSUN_FLEET_UNLOCK2
event.text: The fleet the Lost Suns mentioned isn't present at the co-ordinates they gave, but the cruiser is! The ship hails you, a gruff Rockman with a scar down his eye staring you down. "The Inquisition has recovered this vessel, and the same shall be for this entire sector. It would be wise for the Federation to cut ties with the Lost Suns and leave at once, or face the wrath of a second Inquisition. It is only a matter of time until the Theocracy rises again; which side do you want to be on?"

choice.text: You're right, the Lost Suns are a pathetic ally to the Theocracy's strength.

event.text: "So you have changed your mind so suddenly? What makes you say these words?"

choice.text: The Lost Suns are rash and violent. The Theocracy knows how to time its strikes.

event.text: The Rockman on the camera changes his composure. "You know nothing then. Too easily persuaded, an unworthy ally to the Lost Suns. Be glad you get off easy, I would much rather squish your head had I orders not to."
"THE INQUISITION HAS NEVER FAILED! We have merely... paused our efforts, until the time is right. The Coalition shall be the spark that reignites the fires of fury in our hearts."

choice.text: Spoken like a true Lost Sun.

event.text: "You dare insult the might and grace of the Elder's holy crusades? You die here!"

choice.text: This isn't a hill to die on. Leave.

event.name: LOSTSUN_FLEET_UNLOCK3
event.text: "Yes, and it is safe to say you have passed. The Lost Suns are not sparing with their alliances. If you truly represent the Federation, then you have done a good job showing your loyalty. The Theocracy will resent ever having crossed our path with you on our side."

"It would be criminal to not extend aid to you as well. I will provide you with quality military supplies to assist you. I have already begun the transfer of the blueprints for this very ship to the Federation, in hopes it will be used in their fight."

choice.text: As a matter of fact, I did overthrow the Rock government once.

event.text: Ariadne breaks into laughter, but stops. "My stars, you ARE the ship we heard about. Overthrow is hardly the word, but you have sent their homeworlds into chaos! Your efforts have been a considerable aid to ours. Allow me to help you in every way I can."
